column4: hey all... I have a question. I recently got a new charger for my laptop. The old one was a 90 Watt brick, and the new one is 65 Watts. Windows doesn't seem to have a problem with it, but when I am booted in ubuntu it constantly switched between charging and discharging the battery and popping up notifications about power remaining that get in the way of what I'm doing. Since windows seems to have no problem I'm wondering if
this is some sort of adjustment that Ubuntu isn't doing automatically? (Side note: if I take the battery out and just run on AC power, I have no problems.)
isn't it the official charger then?
No, but the one on Acer's website is also a 65 Watt supply, so I assumed that they just revised it to draw less power.
ah ok as long as the wattage is right
The computer came with the 90 Watt supply but Acer seems to think that 65 is just fine
no idea anyway
^ that would be most reliable
but.. laptop chargers are dear no?
90 to 65 watts is quite  alot
of difference
I actually tried, but I couldn't find another 90 watt supply anywhere
which was rather confusing
it could just be an ubuntu problem. so many peoplle have problems with ubuntu and laptops
in all areas
it's got the same output voltage
I'll try that
either way, windows works, ubuntu dont

Yeah, I know. I'm not hugely concerned with charge speed because I have a newish battery that has good life, so I usually just charge it while I'm in class or at night. I'm just concerned about this flickering
maybe because of ubuntus high power usage
with the kernel
Yep. Which makes me :( because usually it's the other way around XD
